author: Albert Einstein
text: The only source of knowledge is experience.

author: Maya Angelou
text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: Walt Disney
text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.

author: Mark Twain
text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Confucius
text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Steve Jobs
text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Helen Keller
text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: Henry Ford
text: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: Well done is better than well said.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.

author: Dr. Seuss
text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.

author: Babe Ruth
text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.

author: John Wooden
text: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.

author: Viktor E. Frankl
text: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

author: Rumi
text: What you seek is seeking you.

author: Dalai Lama
text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

author: Tony Robbins
text: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.

author: Aristotle
text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Jim Rohn
text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.

author: C.S. Lewis
text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
